Japanese:
//Text $1B5E60
#WRITE(ptr,$18F338)
革を繋ぎ合わせて作られた上半身鎧。[LINE]
軽くてそこそこ丈夫なため、[LINE]
冒険者たちに長年愛用されている。[END]
English:
//Text $1B5E60
#WRITE(ptr,$18F338)
Upper body armor made of leather.[LINE]
Favored by adventurers due to its[LINE]
lightness and fair protection.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5DF8
#WRITE(ptr,$18F374)
薄い銅板で作られた上半身鎧。[LINE]
天地戦争時代から使われていた、[LINE]
伝統ある鎧。[END]
English:
//Text $1B5DF8
#WRITE(ptr,$18F374)
Upper body armor made of thin[LINE]
bronze. Traditional armor used[LINE]
since the age of the Aeth'er War.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5D98
#WRITE(ptr,$18F3B0)
鉄板で作られた上半身鎧。[LINE]
重いが硬くて頑丈。[LINE]
もっとも身近な金属。[END]
English:
//Text $1B5D98
#WRITE(ptr,$18F3B0)
Upper body armor made of iron, the[LINE]
most familiar of metals. Sturdy and[LINE]
tough, but heavy.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5D40
#WRITE(ptr,$18F3EC)
複数枚の鋼板で作られた上半身鎧。[LINE]
騎士見習たちの愛用品。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B5D40
#WRITE(ptr,$18F3EC)
Upper body armor made of[LINE]
several steel plates. Favored[LINE]
by knight apprentices.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5CE0
#WRITE(ptr,$18F428)
チタン合金で強化した上半身鎧。[LINE]
非常に軽く、並外れた耐食性を持つ。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B5CE0
#WRITE(ptr,$18F428)
Upper body armor strengthened[LINE]
with a titanium alloy. Very light[LINE]
and corrosion resistant.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5C78
#WRITE(ptr,$18F464)
銀細工で装飾された上半身鎧。[LINE]
白い輝きが美しい。[LINE]
聖なる祈りが込められている。[END]
English:
//Text $1B5C78
#WRITE(ptr,$18F464)
Upper body armor decorated with[LINE]
silverwork. Has a beautiful luster[LINE]
and is imbued with prayers.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5C28
#WRITE(ptr,$18F4A0)
金細工で装飾した上半身鎧。[LINE]
別名「豪華な上半身鎧」。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B5C28
#WRITE(ptr,$18F4A0)
Upper body armor decorated[LINE]
with gold. Also known as the[LINE]
"Opulent Armor".[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5BC8
#WRITE(ptr,$18F4DC)
ミスリル細工で装飾された上半身鎧。[LINE]
ドワーフ族の芸術作品といわれる。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B5BC8
#WRITE(ptr,$18F4DC)
Upper body armor decorated[LINE]
with Mithril. Considered to[LINE]
be a Dwarven work of art.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5B70
#WRITE(ptr,$18F518)
金属の環を縫い合わせた上半身鎧。[LINE]
刀剣等の攻撃から身を守る。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B5B70
#WRITE(ptr,$18F518)
Upper body armor sewn with[LINE]
metal rings. Protects the body[LINE]
from slashing attacks.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5AF8
#WRITE(ptr,$18F554)
鋼糸で縫製された上半身鎧。[LINE]
すぐに着ることができるのが特徴。[LINE]
多くの戦士たちに愛用されている。[END]
English:
//Text $1B5AF8
#WRITE(ptr,$18F554)
Upper body armor sewn with[LINE]
steel wires. Easy to put on and[LINE]
a favorite of soldiers.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5A80
#WRITE(ptr,$18F590)
美しく磨かれた白い上半身鎧。[LINE]
祭儀用に使われる純白の鎧。[LINE]
光の加護を受けると言われている。[END]
English:
//Text $1B5A80
#WRITE(ptr,$18F590)
Beautifully polished upper body armor.[LINE]
Pure white armor used in rituals. Said[LINE]
to hold the divine protection of light.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5A10
#WRITE(ptr,$18F5CC)
王国騎士団が装備する上半身鎧。[LINE]
頑強な作りであり品のある色。[LINE]
これであなたも騎士気分。[END]
English:
//Text $1B5A10
#WRITE(ptr,$18F5CC)
Upper body armor of a Royal Knightly[LINE]
order. Constructed to be sturdy. With[LINE]
this you too can feel like a Knight.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B59A0
#WRITE(ptr,$18F608)
特殊加工して作られた非常に軽い[LINE]
上半身鎧。流星のように速く動ける。[LINE]
と、宣伝されている。[END]
English:
//Text $1B59A0
#WRITE(ptr,$18F608)
Extremely light upper body armor made with a[LINE]
special process. Allows one to move as fast[LINE]
as a falling star. Or so it is advertised.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5948
#WRITE(ptr,$18F644)
ダイヤモンドで装飾された上半身鎧。[LINE]
その輝きは敵の目を眩ます。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B5948
#WRITE(ptr,$18F644)
Upper body armor decorated with[LINE]
diamonds. Bewilders enemies[LINE]
with its brightness.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B58D8
#WRITE(ptr,$18F680)
戦闘用に特化した上半身鎧。[LINE]
機能性を重視して作られているため、[LINE]
どんな動きも遮らない。[END]
English:
//Text $1B58D8
#WRITE(ptr,$18F680)
Upper body armor made specially for combat.[LINE]
Since it is made with functionality in mind it[LINE]
doesn't hinder one's movements.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5880
#WRITE(ptr,$18F6BC)
名工ギースの魂のこもった[LINE]
無二の傑作。[LINE]
きわめて希少価値が高い。[END]
English:
//Text $1B5880
#WRITE(ptr,$18F6BC)
Masterpiece imbued with[LINE]
the soul of Giese.[LINE]
Extremely valuable.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5808
#WRITE(ptr,$18F6F8)
鉄板を鱗状に縫いつけた上半身鎧。[LINE]
古くから存在する歴史のある鎧。[LINE]
歩くと音が響くのが難点。[END]
English:
//Text $1B5808
#WRITE(ptr,$18F6F8)
Upper body armor sewn with steel scales.[LINE]
A storied and ancient armor. Its only fault[LINE]
is that it's noisy when moving.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B57A0
#WRITE(ptr,$18F734)
チェインアーマーを鋼板で強化した[LINE]
上半身鎧。チェインより堅いが[LINE]
より重い。[END]
English:
//Text $1B57A0
#WRITE(ptr,$18F734)
Chain Armor strengthened with[LINE]
steel plates. Tougher than Chain[LINE]
Armor, but also heavier.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5750
#WRITE(ptr,$18F770)
黒く輝く美しい上半身鎧。[LINE]
祭儀用に使われる漆黒の鎧。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B5750
#WRITE(ptr,$18F770)
A beautiful and shining black[LINE]
armor. Jet black armor used[LINE]
in rituals.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B56F0
#WRITE(ptr,$18F7AC)
簡素でいて典雅な造りの上半身鎧。[LINE]
過去に興った美術様式を汲んだ[LINE]
作品。[END]
English:
//Text $1B56F0
#WRITE(ptr,$18F7AC)
A simple, but elegant upper body armor.[LINE]
Its beautiful style draws inspiration[LINE]
from a bygone era.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5678
#WRITE(ptr,$18F7E8)
希望のルーンが刻まれた上半身鎧。[LINE]
どんな時でも挫けない[LINE]
強い心を身に付けた者に与えられる。[END]
English:
//Text $1B5678
#WRITE(ptr,$18F7E8)
Upper body armor engraved with the Hope[LINE]
rune. Imbues its users with the strength[LINE]
of mind to never be disheartened.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5610
#WRITE(ptr,$18F824)
プラチナで装飾された上半身鎧。[LINE]
上位の騎士達が身に付ける、[LINE]
美麗でいて堅固な鎧。[END]
English:
//Text $1B5610
#WRITE(ptr,$18F824)
Upper body armor decorated with[LINE]
platinum. A solid and beautiful armor[LINE]
worn by high-ranking knights.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B55A0
#WRITE(ptr,$18F860)
ドラゴンの鱗で強化した上半身鎧。[LINE]
ドラゴンの鋭い爪から身を守り、[LINE]
吐く炎をも遮る。[END]
English:
//Text $1B55A0
#WRITE(ptr,$18F860)
Upper body armor strengthened with[LINE]
dragon scales. Protects against a[LINE]
dragon's sharp claws and fiery breath.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5530
#WRITE(ptr,$18F89C)
伝説に登場する幻想の力を秘めた[LINE]
上半身鎧。口伝を書物にまとめた[LINE]
兄弟の名を冠する。[END]
English:
//Text $1B5530
#WRITE(ptr,$18F89C)
Armor imbued with the hidden power of[LINE]
fantasies. Named after the brothers[LINE]
who collected oral traditions into a book.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B54D8
#WRITE(ptr,$18F8D8)
名も無き鍛冶屋の無二の傑作。[LINE]
どんな衝撃でも皹すら入らない。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B54D8
#WRITE(ptr,$18F8D8)
A peerless masterpiece made by[LINE]
an unknown blacksmith. Will never[LINE]
crack no matter the attack.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5480
#WRITE(ptr,$18F914)
要塞と呼ばれる堅固な上半身鎧。[LINE]
死角のない鉄壁な守りを誇る。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B5480
#WRITE(ptr,$18F914)
Upper body armor referred to as[LINE]
a fortress. Feels like an impregnable[LINE]
wall with no openings.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5420
#WRITE(ptr,$18F950)
戦場を駆ける兵士達の守護神の名。[LINE]
必ず生還する鎧として[LINE]
賞賛されている。[END]
English:
//Text $1B5420
#WRITE(ptr,$18F950)
Designated after the deity that protects[LINE]
soldiers on the battlefield. Praised as the[LINE]
armor that guarantees their return.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B53C8
#WRITE(ptr,$18F98C)
力が倍増する魔力を秘めている帯。[LINE]
雷神の持ち物と言われている。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B53C8
#WRITE(ptr,$18F98C)
Ensorcelled sash that doubles[LINE]
one's might. Said to be the[LINE]
possession of a thunder God.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5358
#WRITE(ptr,$18F9C8)
攻撃を反射すると言われる上半身鎧。[LINE]
天地戦争時代の天才科学者が[LINE]
作ったと言われている。[END]
English:
//Text $1B5358
#WRITE(ptr,$18F9C8)
Upper body armor that is said to reflect[LINE]
attacks. Said to have been invented by a[LINE]
genius scientist during the Aeth'er War.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B52F8
#WRITE(ptr,$18FA04)
大地母神の守護を受けた上半身鎧。[LINE]
聖なるオーラが外敵から身を守る。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B52F8
#WRITE(ptr,$18FA04)
Upper body armor imbued with the[LINE]
Earth Goddess' protection. Protects[LINE]
the body with a holy aura.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5298
#WRITE(ptr,$18FA40)
聖戦に赴く騎士のための上半身鎧。[LINE]
装備した者は、信仰の力で[LINE]
守護される。[END]
English:
//Text $1B5298
#WRITE(ptr,$18FA40)
Upper body armor made for knights[LINE]
heading to holy war. Protects its[LINE]
wearers with the power of faith.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5220
#WRITE(ptr,$18FA7C)
「調和」を意味する上半身鎧。[LINE]
全ての均衡を正す使徒となる。[LINE]
選ばれた者のみが手にできる。[END]
English:
//Text $1B5220
#WRITE(ptr,$18FA7C)
Upper body armor that carries the meaning[LINE]
of "Harmony". Turns one into a disciple of[LINE]
balance. Can only be acquired by the chosen ones.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B51B8
#WRITE(ptr,$18FAB8)
革製の胸当て。[LINE]
軽くてそこそこ丈夫なため、[LINE]
冒険者たちに長年愛用されている。[END]
English:
//Text $1B51B8
#WRITE(ptr,$18FAB8)
Leathern breastplate. Favored by[LINE]
adventurers due to its lightness[LINE]
and fair protection.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5160
#WRITE(ptr,$18FAF4)
鉄板で強化した胸当て。[LINE]
重いが硬くて頑丈。[LINE]
伝統ある胸当て。[END]
English:
//Text $1B5160
#WRITE(ptr,$18FAF4)
Breastplate strengthened with[LINE]
iron plates. A heavy, but sturdy,[LINE]
traditional breastplate.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5118
#WRITE(ptr,$18FB30)
鋼板で強化した胸当て。[LINE]
兵士達の愛用品。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B5118
#WRITE(ptr,$18FB30)
Breastplate strengthened[LINE]
with steel plates. A favorite[LINE]
of soldiers.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B50B8
#WRITE(ptr,$18FB6C)
チタン合金で強化した胸当て。[LINE]
非常に軽く、並外れた耐食性を持つ。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B50B8
#WRITE(ptr,$18FB6C)
Breastplate strengthened[LINE]
with a titanium alloy. Very light[LINE]
and corrosion resistant.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5050
#WRITE(ptr,$18FBA8)
銀細工で装飾された胸当て。[LINE]
白い輝きが美しい。[LINE]
聖なる祈りが込められている。[END]
English:
//Text $1B5050
#WRITE(ptr,$18FBA8)
Breastplate decorated with[LINE]
silverwork. Has a beautiful luster[LINE]
and is imbued with prayers.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5000
#WRITE(ptr,$18FBE4)
金細工で装飾された胸当て。[LINE]
別名「豪華な胸当て」。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B5000
#WRITE(ptr,$18FBE4)
Breastplate decorated with[LINE]
gold. Also known as the[LINE]
"Opulent Breastplate".[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4FA0
#WRITE(ptr,$18FC20)
ミスリル細工で装飾された胸当て。[LINE]
ドワーフ族の芸術作品といわれる。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B4FA0
#WRITE(ptr,$18FC20)
Breastplate decorated with[LINE]
Mithril. Considered to be[LINE]
a Dwarven work of art.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4F30
#WRITE(ptr,$18FC5C)
特殊加工して作られた非常に軽い[LINE]
胸当て。流星のように速く動ける。[LINE]
と、宣伝されている。[END]
English:
//Text $1B4F30
#WRITE(ptr,$18FC5C)
Extremely light breastplate made using a[LINE]
special process. Allows one to move as fast[LINE]
as a falling star. Or so it is advertised.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4ED8
#WRITE(ptr,$18FC98)
ダイヤモンドで装飾された胸当て。[LINE]
その輝きは敵の目を眩ます。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B4ED8
#WRITE(ptr,$18FC98)
Breastplate decorated with[LINE]
diamonds. Bewilders enemies[LINE]
with its brightness.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4E70
#WRITE(ptr,$18FCD4)
戦闘用に特化した胸当て。[LINE]
機能性重視で作られたため、[LINE]
とても丈夫で動きやすい。[END]
English:
//Text $1B4E70
#WRITE(ptr,$18FCD4)
Breastplate made specially for combat.[LINE]
Since it is made with functionality in mind[LINE]
it doesn't hinder one's movements.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5880
#WRITE(ptr,$18FD10)
名工ギースの魂のこもった[LINE]
無二の傑作。[LINE]
きわめて希少価値が高い。[END]
English:
//Text $1B5880
#WRITE(ptr,$18FD10)
Masterpiece imbued with[LINE]
the soul of Giese.[LINE]
Extremely valuable.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4DE8
#WRITE(ptr,$18FD4C)
勇気のルーンが刻まれた胸当て。[LINE]
どんな時でも怯まない、[LINE]
強い心を身に付けた者に与える。[END]
English:
//Text $1B4DE8
#WRITE(ptr,$18FD4C)
Breastplate engraved with the Courage[LINE]
rune. Imbues its users with the strength[LINE]
of mind to never be disheartened.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4D80
#WRITE(ptr,$18FD88)
プラチナで装飾された胸当て。[LINE]
高価で美しいのみならず、[LINE]
堅く機能性に優れた一品。[END]
English:
//Text $1B4D80
#WRITE(ptr,$18FD88)
Breastplate decorated with platinum.[LINE]
Not only expensive and beautiful but[LINE]
also very functional.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4D18
#WRITE(ptr,$18FDC4)
ドラゴンの鱗で強化した胸当て。[LINE]
ドラゴンの鋭い爪から身を守り、[LINE]
吐く炎をも遮る。[END]
English:
//Text $1B4D18
#WRITE(ptr,$18FDC4)
Breastplate strengthened with dragon[LINE]
scales. Protects against a dragon's[LINE]
sharp claws and fiery breath.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4CB0
#WRITE(ptr,$18FE00)
伝説に登場する幻想の力を秘めた[LINE]
胸当て。口伝を書物にまとめた[LINE]
兄弟の名を冠する。[END]
English:
//Text $1B4CB0
#WRITE(ptr,$18FE00)
Breastplate imbued with the hidden power of[LINE]
fantasies. Named after the brothers[LINE]
who collected oral traditions into a book.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4C60
#WRITE(ptr,$18FE3C)
城壁という名の胸当て。[LINE]
強固な守りは、強弓を用いても[LINE]
貫けない。[END]
English:
//Text $1B4C60
#WRITE(ptr,$18FE3C)
Breastplate referred to as a rampart.[LINE]
Provides a staunch defense[LINE]
impenetrable by even heavy bows.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4BF8
#WRITE(ptr,$18FE78)
装備者に活力を与える胸当て。[LINE]
激戦、乱戦にも折れない心を[LINE]
身に付けた者に与える。[END]
English:
//Text $1B4BF8
#WRITE(ptr,$18FE78)
Breastplate that imbues the wearer[LINE]
with vitality. Grants an unbreakable[LINE]
heart even in hard-fought battles.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4B88
#WRITE(ptr,$18FEB4)
天頂の名を冠する胸当て。[LINE]
触れることすら叶わない。羽のよう[LINE]
に軽く、光と風の守護を得る。[END]
English:
//Text $1B4B88
#WRITE(ptr,$18FEB4)
Breastplate named after the[LINE]
Zenith. Light as a feather and[LINE]
blessed by light and wind.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4B10
#WRITE(ptr,$18FEF0)
「再生」を意味する胸当て。[LINE]
倒れることすら許されない。[LINE]
選ばれた者のみが手にできる。[END]
English:
//Text $1B4B10
#WRITE(ptr,$18FEF0)
Breastplate that carries the meaning of[LINE]
"Rebirth". Will not allow one to fall.[LINE]
Can only be acquired by the chosen ones.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4AA8
#WRITE(ptr,$18FF2C)
銅板を縫い付けた男性用衣装。[LINE]
軽くてそこそこ丈夫なため、[LINE]
旅人に好まれている。[END]
English:
//Text $1B4AA8
#WRITE(ptr,$18FF2C)
A man's garment made of bronze plates[LINE]
stitched together. Favored by travelers[LINE]
due to lightness and fair protection.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4A48
#WRITE(ptr,$18FF68)
鉄板を縫い付けた男性用衣装。[LINE]
重いが堅く、戦闘仕様な作りに[LINE]
なっている。[END]
English:
//Text $1B4A48
#WRITE(ptr,$18FF68)
A man's garment made of iron plates[LINE]
stitched together. Heavy but rigid and[LINE]
made for combat.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B49E0
#WRITE(ptr,$18FFA4)
鋼板を縫い付けた男性用衣装。[LINE]
護衛や警備を生業としている人々に[LINE]
使われている。[END]
English:
//Text $1B49E0
#WRITE(ptr,$18FFA4)
A man's garment made of steel plates[LINE]
stitched together. Used by guards and[LINE]
local militias.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4990
#WRITE(ptr,$18FFE0)
金細工で装飾した男性用衣装。[LINE]
別名「豪華な衣装」。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B4990
#WRITE(ptr,$18FFE0)
A man's garment decorated with gold.[LINE]
Also known as the "Opulent Wear."[LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4930
#WRITE(ptr,$19001C)
ミスリルで装飾した男性用衣装。[LINE]
ドワーフ族の芸術作品といわれる。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B4930
#WRITE(ptr,$19001C)
A man's garment decorated with Mithril.[LINE]
Considered to be a Dwarven work of art.[LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B48D0
#WRITE(ptr,$190058)
胸部の防御が強化されている衣装。[LINE]
防御力は高いが、[LINE]
バランスがやや悪い。[END]
English:
//Text $1B48D0
#WRITE(ptr,$190058)
A man's garment with enhanced chest[LINE]
protection. Maintains a high defense,[LINE]
but has rather poor balance.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4860
#WRITE(ptr,$190094)
白く美しい男性用衣装。[LINE]
祭儀用に使われる神聖な衣。[LINE]
光の加護を受けると言われている。[END]
English:
//Text $1B4860
#WRITE(ptr,$190094)
A man's beautiful white garment. Holy[LINE]
clothes used in rituals. Said to hold[LINE]
the divine protection of light.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B47F0
#WRITE(ptr,$1900D0)
王国騎士団御用達の男性用衣装。[LINE]
簡素な作りに見えるが、[LINE]
とても頑強な作りになっている。[END]
English:
//Text $1B47F0
#WRITE(ptr,$1900D0)
Garment used by Royal[LINE]
Knights. Looks plainly[LINE]
made, but is very sturdy.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4780
#WRITE(ptr,$19010C)
戦闘用に特化した男性用衣装。[LINE]
機能性重視で作られたため、[LINE]
とても丈夫で動きやすい。[END]
English:
//Text $1B4780
#WRITE(ptr,$19010C)
Garment made specially for[LINE]
combat. Made for functionality.[LINE]
Sturdy and easy to move in.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B5880
#WRITE(ptr,$190148)
名工ギースの魂のこもった[LINE]
無二の傑作。[LINE]
きわめて希少価値が高い。[END]
English:
//Text $1B5880
#WRITE(ptr,$190148)
Masterpiece imbued with[LINE]
the soul of Giese.[LINE]
Extremely valuable.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B46F0
#WRITE(ptr,$190184)
聖なる力に祝福された男性用衣装。[LINE]
聖なる加護に守られたその衣装は、[LINE]
身に付ける者の命を守るという。[END]
English:
//Text $1B46F0
#WRITE(ptr,$190184)
Garment blessed by[LINE]
holy powers. Protects[LINE]
the life of its wearers.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4678
#WRITE(ptr,$1901C0)
黒生地に銀刺繍の美しい衣装。[LINE]
祭儀用に使われる神聖な衣。[LINE]
闇の加護を受けると言われている。[END]
English:
//Text $1B4678
#WRITE(ptr,$1901C0)
Black garment lined with silver.[LINE]
Holy clothes used in rituals.[LINE]
Said to be imbued with dark powers.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4618
#WRITE(ptr,$1901FC)
簡素で典雅な造りの男性用衣装。[LINE]
過去に興った美術様式を汲んだ[LINE]
作品。[END]
English:
//Text $1B4618
#WRITE(ptr,$1901FC)
A simple, but elegant garment.[LINE]
Its beautiful style draws inspiration[LINE]
from a bygone era.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B45B0
#WRITE(ptr,$190238)
ドラゴンの鱗で強化した衣装。[LINE]
ドラゴンの鋭い爪から身を守り、[LINE]
吐く炎をも遮る。[END]
English:
//Text $1B45B0
#WRITE(ptr,$190238)
Garment strengthened with dragon[LINE]
scales. Protects against a dragon's[LINE]
sharp claws and fiery breath.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4540
#WRITE(ptr,$190274)
伝説に登場する幻想の力を秘めた[LINE]
男性用衣装。口伝を書物にまとめた[LINE]
兄弟の名を冠する。[END]
English:
//Text $1B4540
#WRITE(ptr,$190274)
Garment imbued with the hidden power of[LINE]

Japanese:
//Text $1B44D0
#WRITE(ptr,$1902B0)
二重構造の男性用衣装。[LINE]
衝撃から身を守るだけではなく、[LINE]
あらゆる毒からも身を守る。[END]
English:
//Text $1B44D0
#WRITE(ptr,$1902B0)
Garment with a double structure.[LINE]
Not only does it protect against[LINE]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4460
#WRITE(ptr,$1902EC)
道化の名を冠した男性用衣装。[LINE]
その昔、笑いで世界を救おうと[LINE]
旅をした道化人の衣装。[END]
English:
//Text $1B4460
#WRITE(ptr,$1902EC)
Garment named after clowns.[LINE]
Used by a group of traveling clowns[LINE]
who saved the world with laughter.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4400
#WRITE(ptr,$190328)
美しい朱色の紋章入りの衣装。[LINE]
朱色が血のようにも見える[LINE]
怪しげな服。[END]
English:
//Text $1B4400
#WRITE(ptr,$190328)
Garment sporting a beautiful[LINE]
scarlet crest. Suspicious[LINE]
clothes red as blood.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4388
#WRITE(ptr,$190364)
演奏者の名を冠する男性用衣装。[LINE]
演奏者の邪魔にならないように[LINE]
衣擦れの音はまったくしない。[END]
English:
//Text $1B4388
#WRITE(ptr,$190364)
Garment named after actors.[LINE]
Does not bother performers[LINE]
as it makes no rustling sounds.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4318
#WRITE(ptr,$1903A0)
「伝説」を意味する男性用衣装。[LINE]
身に纏った者は英雄と謳われる。[LINE]
選ばれた者のみが手にできる。[END]
English:
//Text $1B4318
#WRITE(ptr,$1903A0)
Garment that carries the meaning of "Myths".[LINE]
Its wearers are celebrated as heroes. Can[LINE]
only be acquired by the chosen ones.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B42B0
#WRITE(ptr,$1903DC)
革製のクローク。[LINE]
軽くてそこそこ丈夫なため、[LINE]
女性の冒険者に愛用されている。[END]
English:
//Text $1B42B0
#WRITE(ptr,$1903DC)
Favored by female adventurers[LINE]
due to its lightness and fair[LINE]
protection.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4258
#WRITE(ptr,$190418)
白い布地であしらえたクローク。[LINE]
清楚なスタイルで街娘にも人気。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B4258
#WRITE(ptr,$190418)
Cloak decorated with white[LINE]
cloth. Its tidy style is popular[LINE]
with city girls.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4208
#WRITE(ptr,$190454)
水鳥の羽毛で縫製されたクローク。[LINE]
羽のように軽い。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B4208
#WRITE(ptr,$190454)
Cloak sewn with the feathers of[LINE]

[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B41B0

[END]
English:
//Text $1B41B0

Cloak decorated with black[LINE]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4150

絹で縫製されたクローク。[LINE]
光沢が美しく、滑らかな肌触りで[LINE]

English:
//Text $1B4150

Cloak sewn with silk. It[LINE]

Japanese:
//Text $1B4100
#WRITE(ptr,$190508)
銀細工で装飾されたクローク。[LINE]

[END]
English:
//Text $1B4100
#WRITE(ptr,$190508)
Robe decorated with[LINE]

Japanese:
//Text $1B40B0

金細工で装飾されたクローク。[LINE]

[END]
English:
//Text $1B40B0
#WRITE(ptr,$190544)

Japanese:
//Text $1B4050

[END]
English:

Cloak decorated with[LINE]

Japanese:

網目状に編んだクローク。[LINE]

English:
//Text $1B3FF8

Japanese:

[END]

English:

English:

English:

Cloak blessed by holy powers.[LINE]

Japanese:

偉大なる聖職者の名がつけられた[LINE]

English:
//Text $1B3C50
#WRITE(ptr,$190814)
A cloak named after a grand[LINE]

Japanese:

原料や生成が不明なクローク。[LINE]

//Text $1B5880
#WRITE(ptr,$190E68)
名工ギースの魂のこもった[LINE]
無二の傑作。[LINE]
きわめて希少価値が高い。[END]
English:
//Text $1B5880
#WRITE(ptr,$190E68)
Masterpiece imbued with[LINE]
the soul of Giese.[LINE]
Extremely valuable.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B31F8
#WRITE(ptr,$190EA4)
ストレイライズ神殿のローブ。[LINE]
神の使徒となった日に[LINE]
渡される制服。[END]
English:
//Text $1B31F8
#WRITE(ptr,$190EA4)
Robe of the Straylize Temple.[LINE]
Uniform handed out to those[LINE]
who become disciples of God.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B3188
#WRITE(ptr,$190EE0)
偉大なる聖職者の名がつけられた[LINE]
ローブ。彼の愛したニワトコの花で[LINE]
染められている。[END]
English:
//Text $1B3188
#WRITE(ptr,$190EE0)
A robe named after a grand[LINE]
priest, dyed with the flowers[LINE]
of his beloved elderberries.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B3130
#WRITE(ptr,$190F1C)
原料や生成が不明なローブ。[LINE]
見る角度により色が変化する。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B3130
#WRITE(ptr,$190F1C)
Robe made by an unknown process[LINE]
and materials. Its colors change with[LINE]
viewing angle.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B30B8
#WRITE(ptr,$190F58)
安息のルーンが刺繍されたローブ。[LINE]
どんな辛い苦行でも、耐えられる[LINE]
力を身につけた者に与える。[END]
English:
//Text $1B30B8
#WRITE(ptr,$190F58)
Robe embroidered with the Rest[LINE]
rune. Imbues one with the power[LINE]
to resist any punishment.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B3048
#WRITE(ptr,$190F94)
位の高い術士が着るローブ。[LINE]
精神量を増加させ、練りこまれた[LINE]
呪術が敵の攻撃から身を守る。[END]
English:
//Text $1B3048
#WRITE(ptr,$190F94)
Robe worn by high-ranking mages.[LINE]
Increases one's willpower and[LINE]
protects against enemy attacks.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2FF8
#WRITE(ptr,$190FD0)
虹色の光を放つローブ。[LINE]
光の屈折により敵を惑わす。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B2FF8
#WRITE(ptr,$190FD0)
Robe that breaks light into the[LINE]
colors of the rainbow. Bewilders[LINE]
enemies with its refracted light.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2F90
#WRITE(ptr,$19100C)
伝説に登場する幻想の力を秘めた[LINE]
ローブ。口伝を書物にまとめた[LINE]
兄弟の名を冠する。[END]
English:
//Text $1B2F90
#WRITE(ptr,$19100C)
Robe imbued with the hidden power of[LINE]
fantasies. Named after the brothers[LINE]
who collected oral traditions into a book.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2F20
#WRITE(ptr,$191048)
フィッツガルドで密かなブームに[LINE]
なっている服。家事の時でも[LINE]
可愛さを忘れないアイテム。[END]
English:
//Text $1B2F20
#WRITE(ptr,$191048)
Clothes that became a secret boom[LINE]
in Fitzgald. Item for those who do not ignore[LINE]
cuteness even while doing housework.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2EB8
#WRITE(ptr,$191084)
細身で透け感の際どいドレス。[LINE]
涼しく着心地が良くて快適。[LINE]
少し勇気はいる。[END]
English:
//Text $1B2EB8
#WRITE(ptr,$191084)
Risky, thin, and see-through dress.[LINE]
Feels pleasantly refreshing. Requires[LINE]
a little confidence to wear.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2E68
#WRITE(ptr,$1910C0)
田園調の素朴なドレス。[LINE]
懐古趣味な貴族たちに人気。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B2E68
#WRITE(ptr,$1910C0)
Simple country dress.[LINE]
Popular among nostalgic aristocrats.[LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2E00
#WRITE(ptr,$1910FC)
アクアヴェイルで生まれたドレス。[LINE]
女性のボディラインを美しく[LINE]
見せてくれる。[END]
English:
//Text $1B2E00
#WRITE(ptr,$1910FC)
Dress created in Aquaveil.[LINE]
Emphasizes the beauty of[LINE]
the female figure.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2DA0
#WRITE(ptr,$191138)
粋な情緒の夜会用ドレス。[LINE]
パーティーの必需品。[LINE]
胸元の開きが勝負所。[END]
English:
//Text $1B2DA0
#WRITE(ptr,$191138)
Dress for sophisticated balls.[LINE]
A necessity for parties.[LINE]
Has an open cleavage.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2D58
#WRITE(ptr,$191174)
純白の花嫁衣裳。[LINE]
女の子の憧れ、幸せの象徴。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B2D58
#WRITE(ptr,$191174)
Pure white wedding dress.[LINE]
Yearned for by girls and[LINE]
symbol of happiness.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2CE0
#WRITE(ptr,$1911B0)
「最後」を意味するローブ。[LINE]
世界を滅するほどの力を身に宿す。[LINE]
選ばれた者のみが手にできる。[END]
English:
//Text $1B2CE0
#WRITE(ptr,$1911B0)
Robe that carries the meaning of "End". Protects[LINE]
the body from the power to destroy the world.[LINE]
Can only be acquired by the chosen ones.[END]
